availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Phillip S. Ransom (Pendleton County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Susan Jones Ransom in Boone County, Kentucky, on January 30, 1851. Father of Armstead M. Ransom, James S. Ransom, John R. Ransom, Susan F. Ransom, and Nancy E. Ransom. Farmer with William Cook in Boone County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 187B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 478.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 575A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Boone County Marriages, 1850-1858, Film #000523724, p. 121 of 557 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Pendleton County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 202.
